projects.name: Develop Recipes and complementary foods from aquatic foods
projects.description: Initiatives are being launched to develop recipes and complementary foods derived from aquatic sources, enhancing nutritional options for communities. A Social Behavior Communication Change (SBCC) strategy is being crafted to encourage increased fish consumption among households and communities. As part of this effort, procurement of aquatic food packaging and labeling materials is essential to promote these products effectively. projects.description: This includes the procurement of essential farm tools and implements such as line levels, ropes, range poles, pick axes, crow bars, and sledge hammers. projects.name: Introduce fishing boat license number plate
projects.description: To enhance fisheries management, an initiative is underway to introduce fishing boat license number plates, which will help in regulating and tracking fishing activities. In addition, efforts will be made to assess the biological and ecological information of selected Marine Protected Areas (MPAs) and create detailed maps to support conservation efforts. The procurement of an unmanned survey vehicle (USV) will facilitate advanced data collection and monitoring of aquatic environments. Furthermor

projects.name: Advancing the National Adaptation Planning (NAP) Process in Eritrea
projects.description: The Readiness Proposal for  “Advancing the National Adaptation Planning (NAP) Process in Eritrea,” GCF pipeline project was approved on 25 June 2024. The objective of the NAP Process Project is to support the  State of Eritrea to build capacity, tools and planning systems for the consultative and iterative elaboration of a National Adaptation Plan (NAP) and its implementation and monitoring at national, sub-national (Zoba and sub-Zoba) and sector levels.
projects.outcome: Capacities of communities and national institutions are enhanced to mitigate, adapt and mainstream climate change and disaster risks
